name: Embassy Suites Buffalo

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel while attending a family wedding in Buffalo. The rooms were very modern and spacious with tons of windows. The bathroom however does not have a fan which I thought was a little odd for being such a nice place. There was a hot breakfast buffet every morning with an omelet station that I would rate as average. The person at the front desk was not overly friendly but nice enough. The valet seemed a little unorganized as it took them 20 minutes to retrieve my car and after waiting they brought me someone else's vehicle. A regular sized bottle of water in the lobby store runs about $2.50 and in the vending machines $2.00 each. A room key is needed to access the elevators and vending areas which is a nice safety feature if you aren't forgetful. There is a salon on the second floor which was nice and decently priced. All of the girls were very friendly. The beds however were extremely comfortable, great night's sleep. This hotel is very centrally located and overall a nice place to stay while in Buffalo.
reviews.title: Great rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extra cost of parking and valet service leave a little to be desired but hotel is very clean and nice. The Complimentary breakfast although good was really crowded and lacked enough seats to accommodate everyone.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay
BUffalo summer trip
reviews.text: Very nice place to stay, convenient, great breakfast and evening reception was good also. Hotel is very quiet great views of the water from our 7th floor suite. Nice patio in front for a evening drink. Great location to restaurants and to get back on the interstate.

In the heart of Downtown Buff. Valet parking only for $15 a night. Spacious suites with two TVs. Pool and Gym on second floor. Elevators are the fastest I've ever seen. Never took more than 6 seconds to arrive! We were on the 4th floor. Made to order breakfast was nice as usual. The maid service was suspect. I asked for replacement towels and they must have thought we didn't want our room cleaned. Asked for extra toilet paper the next day and they didn't clean the room again! The manager's welcome events at night had pretty lousy snacks. Drinks were free but they should upgrade the finger snacks. I'd stay again of course because with a fam of 4 you can save money with the breakfast.
reviews.title: Typical E.S. Vacay

reviews.text: The main reason I continue to stay at the Embassy Suites is that they offer two-room suites which works so well for my family of four. We came to Buffalo to see Niagara Falls. We toured with Gray Line Tours and to pick us up it would have cost $40-60 extra. We were able to drive to the Seneca Casino/Hotel and park there for free while we went on the 4 hour tour (it was actually a 5 hour tour). It was very nice to be able to come back to the hotel to relax in our rooms. Not really any restaurants within walking distance, so we drove. the couch in the second room pulled out into a bed, plus we had two double beds.
reviews.title: Great suites and complimentary breakfast

reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Buffalo Embassy Suites and altogether we have stayed 7 nights so we have a pretty good feel for the place. With a family of four we love the large rooms, two queen beds and the queen pullout couch. The hotel is fairly new and very well maintained. We asked for extra towels and pillows and they were brought up within 5 minutes. The location is great if you are doing things downtown or as everything in Buffalo and their suburbs is relatively close you are pretty much within 30 minutes of most everything. One highlight and money saver is the free breakfast which is very good, particularly the made to order omelet station. The gym is not huge, but not small and has enough equipment for most people to get in a good workout. Next to the gym is an indoor pool which is smaller than the one next door at the Hampton Inn and we saw parents with young kids using it, but it is not very big. If you're driving a car then you do have to valet it ( the Hampton Inn has a free parking lot for their guests) and it is $15 per day. The valet staff was always quick to bring the car around, usually no more than 5 minutes and when we remembered to call ahead it was always there waiting for us. We got a great rate ( pre-paid) on Hotels.com and overall were very pleased with our stay. We have also stayed at a suite at the Hampton Inn next door and in my opinion the two hotels are very similar, if you can get a suite at the Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Very solid choice, great for families

reviews.text: Strongly recommend this hotel. Friendly and pleasant staff, clean rooms and the suite set up is so lovely when traveling with children. Walk from here to Betty's (0.6 mi) for a great dinner and lovely walk in Buffalo.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: We were 3 people in one of their suites. The second room was tiny. Once the couch was opened it was impossible to get by it (if 2 people opened it one had to crawl over it to get out.
reviews.title: Not up to stanrd we expected

reviews.text: There was no pillow or blanket for the popout and we waited for 40 minutes (at midnight) for them to deliver them...and it took 2 calls to the desk. The next evening we went to the lobby and asked for some wine glasses...and were told to wait in a long line of people waiting for free drinks (actually that was a nice thing if you wanted it). After a bit of a wait (still many people in front of us in line) we were given the glasses....but they were filthy.
reviews.title: Great View, Bad Service

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good and the staff in that area was great. However, the sign for breakfast said 6:30 to (I forget what) but when we came down at 6:30 the next morning (catching an early flight) they did not even have coffee.
reviews.title: It's good value for money

reviews.text: Had a horrible experience at the Adams mark and was able to book this hotel at 1:00 AM Saturday morning. A lot of the roads were closed because of the taste of buffalo making it a little difficult to navigate tot he hotel. But there were ample signs posted to direct us to the embassy. Valet was still available at 2 am and there was an armed hotel security person in the front lobby. Unless this was a guest. Not sure and didn't inquire. I was exhausted and just wanted to get to the room.
reviews.title: Savior of Buffalo

reviews.text: The man working the front desk checked us in quickly and with a smile despite the obvious stress of buffalo at 2 am during one of the cities busiest weekend festivals.
reviews.title: Beautiful View & Wonderful Staff

reviews.text: One great feature of this hotel is elevators require a key card swipe before pushing the floor button. cuts down on people roaming around the hotel, and kept the room quiet.
reviews.title: Clean and would stay again.

reviews.text: The room was immaculate with lots of space. would definitely stay again. showers were nice and hot. Wish they weren't booked for Saturday night.
reviews.title: Modern accommodations in downtown buffalo

reviews.title: Beautiful, comfortable suite

reviews.text: We stayed in Buffalo to enjoy Niagara Falls and the surrounding areas. This hotel is the place to stay. Centrally located in downtown. Offered good hearty breakfast & nice happy hour. Be sure to get the one bedroom suite - very spacious. The staff are all friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Comfy family place

reviews.text: This time, we were down for the weekend to do some cross-border shopping and based on trip advisor reviews we decided to try the Embassy Suites. We were not disappointed, in fact, it exceeded out expectations.
reviews.title: Good Hotel/Good food/
Great Hotel - beds and rooms you don't want to leave!
reviews.text: Brand new, clean, and ultra-modern, the rooms I believe, are all two room suites, and far more spacious than other Embassy Suites we have stayed in, particularly, the first room where you find the pull-our couch/double bed.

description: The Embassy Suites Buffalo is a new property built to green construction standards in the heart of downtown Buffalo. While staying with our hotel you'll be treated to cityscape views, complimentary wireless Internet, complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast every morning and a nightly manager's reception featuring complimentary appetizers and cocktails.Each spacious 2-room suites feature separates living rooms and bedrooms. Each bed is equipped with 250-thread count Sleep Essentials™ bedding, designer furniture including a pull out sofa, plush armchairs, work desk, and ottomans, two flat-screen televisions, two telephones, a mini-fridge, wet bar, microwave and more. On-site you'll find two restaurants that offer a variety of meal options. Della Terra is a beautiful two story, glass enclosed restaurant featuring northern Italian cuisine. The Avant Beanery is our lobby espresso bar that features Starbucks® coffees and serves pre-made salads, sandwiches and pastries. We also provide room service for those who want to enjoy a delicious meal in the privacy of their room.Our hotel is also perfect for business meetings and wedding receptions. Our contemporary facilities include seven meeting rooms with a combined total of 6,034 square feet. A complimentary 24-hour business center is perfect for those last minute business needs. We are happy to help plan your business gatherings; events, weddings and we offer full catering and audio/visual support.
